PCRSimPlot

Source: vignettes/PCRSimPlot.Rmd
PCRSimPlot.Rmd
library(PCRSimPlot)

Introduction

The PCRSimPlot package provides functions to simulate and plot PCR (Polymerase Chain Reaction) data. This vignette demonstrates how to use the simulate_pcr() and plot_pcr() functions to generate and visualize PCR data.

Simulate PCR Data

Use the simulate_pcr() function to generate simulated PCR data. This function requires initial DNA concentration (N0), amplification efficiency (E), and an optional fluorescence threshold.

result <- simulate_pcr(N0 = 10, E = 1.8)

The simulate_pcr() function returns a list with two components: pcr_data (a data frame of simulated PCR data) and Ct (the cycle threshold value).

print(result$pcr_data)
#>    Cycle          DNA Fluorescence
#> 1      1 1.000000e+01 1.029830e+03
#> 2      2 3.240000e+01 1.106058e+03
#> 3      3 5.832000e+01 1.194265e+03
#> 4      4 1.049760e+02 1.353038e+03
#> 5      5 1.889568e+02 1.638828e+03
#> 6      6 3.401222e+02 2.153251e+03
#> 7      7 6.122200e+02 3.079211e+03
#> 8      8 1.101996e+03 4.745940e+03
#> 9      9 1.983593e+03 7.746053e+03
#> 10    10 3.570467e+03 1.314626e+04
#> 11    11 6.426841e+03 2.286662e+04
#> 12    12 1.156831e+04 4.036328e+04
#> 13    13 2.082296e+04 7.185726e+04
#> 14    14 3.748134e+04 1.285464e+05
#> 15    15 6.746641e+04 2.305869e+05
#> 16    16 1.214395e+05 4.142598e+05
#> 17    17 2.185912e+05 7.448710e+05
#> 18    18 3.934641e+05 1.339971e+06
#> 19    19 7.082353e+05 2.411152e+06
#> 20    20 1.274824e+06 4.339276e+06
#> 21    21 2.294683e+06 7.809900e+06
#> 22    22 4.130429e+06 1.405702e+07
#> 23    23 7.434771e+06 2.530185e+07
#> 24    24 1.338259e+07 4.554253e+07
#> 25    25 2.408866e+07 8.197575e+07
#> 26    26 4.335959e+07 1.475556e+08
#> 27    27 7.804726e+07 2.655992e+08
#> 28    28 1.404851e+08 4.780778e+08
#> 29    29 2.528731e+08 8.605392e+08
#> 30    30 4.551716e+08 1.548970e+09
#> 31    31 8.193089e+08 2.788145e+09
#> 32    32 1.474756e+09 5.018660e+09
#> 33    33 2.654561e+09 9.033587e+09
#> 34    34 4.778209e+09 1.626046e+10
#> 35    35 8.600777e+09 2.926882e+10
#> 36    36 1.548140e+10 5.268387e+10
#> 37    37 2.786652e+10 9.483097e+10
#> 38    38 5.015973e+10 1.706957e+11
#> 39    39 9.028751e+10 3.072523e+11
#> 40    40 1.625175e+11 5.530542e+11
print(result$Ct)
#> [1] 9

Plot PCR Data

Use the plot_pcr() function to visualize the simulated PCR data. This function creates a ggplot object showing fluorescence over cycles, with a vertical line indicating the cycle threshold (Ct).

plot <- plot_pcr(result$pcr_data, result$Ct)
print(plot)

Conclusion

The PCRSimPlot package provides an easy way to simulate and visualize PCR data. Use the provided functions to gain insights into PCR dynamics and results.
